content: उपपत्तिः {%<ab>f.</ab>%} {@--1@} Happening, occurring, becoming visible, appearance, production, birth <ls>Śi. 1. 69</ls> (जन्म); इष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु <ls>Bg. 13. 9.</ls> {@--2@} Cause, reason, ground; प्रियेषु यैः पार्थ विनोपपत्तेः <ls>Ki. 3. 52.</ls> {@--3@} Reasoning, argument; उपपत्तिमदूर्जितं वचः <ls>Ki. 2. 1</ls> argumentative; giving a reason for the establishment of a matter; <ls>S. D. 482.</ls> {@--4@} Fitness, propriety. {@--5@} Termination, end. {@--6@} Association, connection. {@--7@} Acceptance, adoption; <ls>Mv. 5.</ls> {@--8@} Ascertainment, demonstration, demonstrated conclusion; उपपत्तिरुदाहृता बलात् <ls>Ki. 2. 28.</ls> {@--9@} (In <ab>Arith.</ab> or Geom.) Proof, demonstration. {@--10@} A means, an expedient. {@--11@} Assistance, support, help; <ls>Ki. 14. 44.</ls> {@--12@} Doing, effecting, gaining; accomplishment; स्वार्थोपपत्तिं दुर्बलाशः <ls>R. 5. 12</ls>; तात्पर्यानुपपत्तितः Bhaṣa P.; <ls>H. 3. 118</ls>; see अनुपपत्ति. {@--13@} Attainment, getting; असंशयं प्राक् तनयोपपत्तेः <ls>R. 14. 78</ls>; <ls>Ki. 3. 1.</ls> {@--14@} Religious abstraction (समाधि).
